intro: Crepis oliveriana, commonly known as Oliver's mouse-ear, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing perennial that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal rosettes of narrow, silvery-hairy leaves and produces small, dandelion-like yellow flowers. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in dry, rocky, or sandy soils. Crepis oliveriana is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens or as a ground cover in suitable climates.
